attributes.action: Mandatory Monthly Mental Health Class For 14-16 Year Olds In UK Education.
attributes.additional_details: This is a necessity to make change for our younger generation in helping manage their mental health and have a greater dialogue being held around speaking around their mental health. Mental Health related suicide is a pandemic in its own right in the age group of 25-40 in UK Men. Its is imperative a greater step is taken to protect the mental health of our own younger generation.
attributes.background: We need to look to create a programme for all schools to deliver a mandatory Mental Health Class for young adults in our UK schools. This would be delivered at a monthly rate or at worst a Term based class. The importance of monthly is to keep a regular dialogue in place to assist this.

rejection.details:
The Government sets the national curriculum for schools, but how this is delivered and how schools meet the health, including mental health, needs of their students is a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Fund preventative mental health sessions in schools and workplaces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562785

Provide more funding to schools for mental health programmes: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574673

Make mental health awareness part of the national curriculum at all levels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561016

Fund a national awareness campaign for mental health in schools: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553711
